info.title: Content Jumpstart API
info.description: Backend API for 30-Day Content Jumpstart Operator Dashboard

get.description:
Health check endpoint.

Returns API status and rate limit statistics.

Serve React app at root URL with cache prevention.

Critical: HTML file must not be cached to ensure users get
the latest version and correct chunk references after deployments.
Serve favicon (uses vite.svg)

post.description:
Login with email and password.
Returns access and refresh tokens.

Refresh access token using refresh token.
Returns new access and refresh tokens (without user data).

Register a new user and return authentication tokens.
(In production, this might be restricted to admins only)

get.description:
Basic health check endpoint.

Returns:
    Health status dictionary

Database connection pool health check.

Returns detailed information about:
- Connection pool status
- Pool utilization
- Health recommendations
- Configuration settings

Use this endpoint to:
- Monitor pool usage
- Tune pool settings
- Diagnose connection issues
- Track performance over time

Database pool event counters.

Returns:
    Pool event statistics (if available)

Query cache statistics and health.

Returns detailed information about:
- Cache size and capacity
- Hit/miss rates
- Cache effectiveness
- TTL settings

Query Parameters:
    tier: Optional cache tier to view (short, medium, long)
          If not specified, returns stats for all tiers

Use this endpoint to:
- Monitor cache performance
- Tune cache sizes
- Diagnose caching issues
- Track cache hit rates

post.description:
Clear query cache.

Use this endpoint to manually invalidate caches when needed.

Query Parameters:
    tier: Optional cache tier to clear (if not specified, clears all tiers)
    key_prefix: Optional key prefix for selective clearing

Examples:
    - Clear all caches: POST /health/cache/clear
    - Clear short tier: POST /health/cache/clear?tier=short
    - Clear projects: POST /health/cache/clear?key_prefix=projects
    - Clear short projects: POST /health/cache/clear?tier=short&key_prefix=projects

parameters.name: tier

schema.description: Cache tier to clear (short, medium, long)
schema.title: Tier

parameters.description: Cache tier to clear (short, medium, long)

post.description:
Reset cache statistics counters.

This resets hit/miss/set/invalidation counters to zero
without clearing the cached data.

Useful for measuring cache performance over a specific period.

get.description:
Comprehensive health check including all subsystems.

Returns:
    Complete health status with all components

Query profiling overview and performance report.

Returns detailed information about:
- Total queries executed
- Query performance statistics
- Top slowest queries
- Recent slow queries
- Performance recommendations

Use this endpoint to:
- Identify slow queries
- Find optimization opportunities
- Monitor query performance trends
- Debug performance issues

Detailed query statistics.

Query Parameters:
    min_execution_count: Only return queries executed at least this many times
    min_avg_time_ms: Only return queries with avg time >= this threshold
    only_slow: Only return queries with slow executions
    limit: Maximum results to return

Returns:
    List of query statistics with execution metrics

Examples:
    - All queries: GET /health/profiling/queries
    - Slow queries only: GET /health/profiling/queries?only_slow=true
    - Frequently executed: GET /health/profiling/queries?min_execution_count=100
    - Slowest on average: GET /health/profiling/queries?min_avg_time_ms=50

parameters.name: only_slow

schema.description: Only show queries with slow executions
schema.title: Only Slow

parameters.description: Only show queries with slow executions

get.description:
Recent slow query executions.

Query Parameters:
    limit: Maximum number of results
    since_minutes: Show queries from last N minutes
    very_slow_only: Only show very slow queries (>500ms)

Returns:
    List of recent slow queries with timestamps

Examples:
    - Last 50 slow queries: GET /health/profiling/slow-queries
    - Last hour: GET /health/profiling/slow-queries?since_minutes=60
    - Critical only: GET /health/profiling/slow-queries?very_slow_only=true

parameters.name: since_minutes

schema.description: Show queries from last N minutes
schema.title: Since Minutes

parameters.description: Show queries from last N minutes

post.description:
Reset query profiling statistics.

This clears all accumulated profiling data:
- Query statistics
- Slow query history
- Performance metrics

Useful for:
- Starting fresh profiling session
- Clearing old data after optimization
- Resetting after load testing

get.description: List all clients

schema.title: Response List Clients Api Clients  Get

get.description: Get client by ID

List all projects with optional filters.

Pagination:
- Hybrid approach: offset pagination for first 5 pages, cursor for deeper pagination
- Use 'page' parameter for traditional pagination (e.g., page=1, page=2)
- Use 'cursor' parameter for efficient deep pagination (get cursor from previous response)
- Automatically switches to cursor pagination when page >= 6

Caching:
- max-age: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- stale-while-revalidate: 600 seconds (10 minutes)
- ETag support for 304 Not Modified responses

Example:
    GET /api/projects?page=1&page_size=20
    GET /api/projects?cursor=2025-12-15T10:30:00:proj-abc123&page_size=20

schema.title: Response List Projects Api Projects  Get

post.description:
Create a new project.

Cache invalidation: Signals clients to invalidate projects cache.

get.description:
Get project by ID.

Caching:
- max-age: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- ETag support for 304 Not Modified responses

patch.description:
Update project (supports both PUT and PATCH).

Cache invalidation: Signals clients to invalidate projects cache.

put.description:
Update project (supports both PUT and PATCH).

Cache invalidation: Signals clients to invalidate projects cache.

delete.description:
Delete project.

Cache invalidation: Signals clients to invalidate projects cache.

get.description: Get brief by ID
List all runs with optional filters

schema.title: Response List Runs Api Runs  Get

get.description: Get run by ID
List deliverables with optional filters

schema.title: Response List Deliverables Api Deliverables  Get

get.description: Get deliverable by ID

Download deliverable file.

Returns the file as an attachment with appropriate headers.
Validates file existence and path security.

Get deliverable with extended details including:
- File preview (first 5000 characters)
- Related posts from the same run
- QA summary statistics
- File modification timestamp

This endpoint is used by the enhanced deliverable drawer
to display comprehensive information about a deliverable.

List posts with comprehensive filtering options.

Pagination:
- Hybrid approach: offset pagination for first 5 pages, cursor for deeper pagination
- Use 'page' parameter for traditional pagination (e.g., page=1, page=2)
- Use 'cursor' parameter for efficient deep pagination (get cursor from previous response)
- Automatically switches to cursor pagination when page >= 6

Supports filtering by:
- Project, run, status
- Platform (linkedin, twitter, facebook, blog)
- CTA presence
- Template name (partial match)
- Review flags (needs_review=true for flagged posts)
- Content search
- Word count range
- Readability score range

Caching:
- max-age: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- stale-while-revalidate: 600 seconds (10 minutes)
- ETag support for 304 Not Modified responses

Example:
    GET /api/posts?page=1&page_size=20&project_id=proj-123
    GET /api/posts?cursor=2025-12-15T10:30:00:post-abc123&page_size=20

parameters.name: platform

schema.description: Filter by platform (linkedin, twitter, facebook, blog)
schema.title: Platform

parameters.description: Filter by platform (linkedin, twitter, facebook, blog)

schema.title: Response List Posts Api Posts  Get

get.description:
Get post by ID.

Caching:
- max-age: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- ETag support for 304 Not Modified responses

patch.description:
Update a post's content.

Updates the content field and recalculates:
- word_count
- readability_score
- has_cta

Returns the updated post.

post.description:
Generate all posts for a project.

This endpoint:
1. Creates a Run record
2. Triggers the CLI content generator
3. Updates Run status
4. Creates Post records

Regenerate specific posts.

Used for quality gate - regenerate flagged posts.

Export deliverable package.

Creates a deliverable file (TXT/DOCX/PDF) from generated posts.

get.description:
List all available research tools.

Returns metadata for all 12 research tools:
- 6 implemented and available
- 6 coming soon

schema.title: Response List Research Tools Api Research Tools Get

post.description:

- Market Trends Research
